oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class OracleModelBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • OracleModel
      • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleModelBase

  • public class OracleModelBase
extends OracleModel
    This class holds general information about the underlying Oracle models used by Oracle model implementations. This class should encapsulate all the information necessary to communicate with the Oracle backend.
    Since:
    release specific (what release of product did this appear in)

    • Constructor Detail

      • OracleModelBase

        public OracleModelBase(Oracle oracle,
                       OracleModelBase omb)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new instance of this class by copying the main parameters of input Oracle model base object, but updating the Oracle object, internal jdbc resources, and internal mappings. The Oracle object must belong to the same schema as in original Oracle model base, otherwise queries may failed. Using this method to avoid the full initialization process of Oracle model base class, and can use an Oracle object from a pool.
        Parameters:
        oracle -
        omb -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • analyze

        public void analyze()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics using default parameters for this graph/dataset. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for this graph (Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model).

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyze

        public void analyze(float estimatePercent,
                    java.lang.String methodOpt)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for this graph/dataset. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        See Oracle documentation "PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.

        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100].
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyze

        public void analyze(float estimatePercent,
                    java.lang.String methodOpt,
                    int dop)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for this graph/dataset. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        See Oracle documentation "PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.

        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100].
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        dop - degree of parallelism.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this current graph/dataset and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke the DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a performInference() call is done, this method should be invoked.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph(float estimatePercent,
                                 java.lang.String methodOpt)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this current graph/dataset and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a performInference call is done, this method should be invoked.

        See the "Oracle Database PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.

        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100]
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph(float estimatePercent,

                                 int dop)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this current graph/dataset and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a performInference call is done, this method should be invoked.

        See the "Oracle Database PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.

        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        dop - degree of parallelism
        Throws:

      • clearRepository

        public void clearRepository()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Remove all quads from the underlying main model in a persistent fashion (e.g. no rollback possible). This method will not remove any data from attached models and will fail if the underlying model is virtual (e.g. read-only).

        This method performs a DDL operation that implicitly commits the transaction and prevents rollback.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • closeWithoutCommit

        public void closeWithoutCommit()
        De-registers this reference to this model base. If no more references exist to this model base, then this method flushes any pending statements and closes this model base instance.

        This method has no effect if this model base is already closed.

        Note that the underlying database connection is not committed and it remains open. Inference, if applicable, will not be updated.

        Cacheable graphs should not call this method. Instead they should use closeWithoutCommit(OracleGraphBase).

        See Also:
        getReferenceCountForGraph(oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleGraphBase), getGlobalReferenceCount(), registerReference(), isClosed(), closeWithoutCommit(OracleGraphBase)

                                 throws java.sql.SQLException

      • createTables

        public void createTables(boolean nologging)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates the corresponding application table and the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph object. A proper database index will be created on the application table. Also, a prefix mapping table will be created. The prefix mapping table will have the following two columns, prefix of type VARCHAR2(50) and namespace of type VARCHAR2(4000).

        Note: This method will ignore errors which report that the tables, RDF/OWL/SKOS model, or indexes already exist. This provides a robust means to initialize an RDF/OWL/SKOS model that is in an indeterminate state, such as from an error during an earlier operation.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error during DDL operations.

      • deleteInference

        public void deleteInference()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops rules index/entailment. Note that transaction will be committed before any logic is carried out.

        Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error generated from the underlying PL/SQL call.

      • dropApplicationTableIndex

        public void dropApplicationTableIndex()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the application table index. Note that there is a DDL operation behind the scenes, so your transaction will be committed. This method can be called before a bulk load or batch load is invoked, as an optimization.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with the underlying DDL.

      • dropTables

        public void dropTables()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the underlying RDF model, any indexes, any rulebase indexes, and the corresponding application table.

        Note: This is robust to errors reporting that a named object does not exist, and will continue to drop any named objects that are part of the repository, in order to clean up partially instantiated repositories.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is any error code other than ORA-13199: Model does not exist. ORA-00942: table or view does not exist will cause a SQLException to be thrown.

      • eraseAndCreate

        public void eraseAndCreate(boolean nologging)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Erases existing models and application tables, then recreates them. This method is a convenience method for calling dropTables() and createTables(boolean).

        NOTE: Calling this method may cause unexpected behavior for existing Oracle graphs using the underlying models and application tables.

        Parameters:
        nologging - if true, then add NOLOGGING when creating the application table
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Cleans up resources, such as closing the model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • flushAdd

        public void flushAdd()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes existing batched JDBC statements for inserting triples. This method call will make sure queries using the same database connection are able to see the triples added through performAdd. However, it should not be confused with a database commit, because other database sessions will not see the changes done in this session. For that to happen, you must invoke commitTransaction.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for DMLs.

      • flushDelete

        public void flushDelete()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes existing batched JDBC statements for removing triples. This method call will make sure queries using the same database connection are able to see the triples removed through delete(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean). However, it should not be confused with a database commit, because other database sessions will not see the changes done in this session. For that to happen, you must invoke commitTransaction().
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for DMLs.

      • getBatchSize

        public int getBatchSize()
        Returns the JDBC batch size used for both addition (using performAdd) and removal (using performDelete) of triples.

      • getDOP

        public int getDOP()
        This method returns the degree of parallelism for underlying SQL operations. Note that the DOP setting has an upper bound controlled by the JVM parameter oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.maxDOP.

        public java.lang.String getNetworkPrefix()
        Returns the prefix to be used with table/view names.
        Returns:
        default is 'MDSYS.' if network owner is not defined, or it is 'network_owner_networkname#' for 19c and beyond databases

      • getSize

        public long getSize(org.apache.jena.graph.Node graphNode,
                    boolean bStrictDefault)
        Returns the number of unique triples/quads contained in this Oracle model. The size reported here does not include those triples/quads contained via attachment.

        Note that this method does not work in readonly case.

      • getStatusForEntailedGraph

        public int getStatusForEntailedGraph()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the status of the inferred graph (entailment). The status can only be one of the following: GraphOracleSem.VALID_ENTAILMENT, GraphOracleSem.INCOMPLETE_ENTAILMENT, GraphOracleSem.INVALID_ENTAILMENT, GraphOracleSem.NO_SUCH_ENTAILMENT, or GraphOracleSem.NO_RULEBASE.
        Returns:
        status of the inferred graph
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getTranslator

        public OracleTranslator getTranslator()
        Returns an instance of OracleTranslator upon request. This instance is created when this graph object is constructed.

      • getUseSessionParams

        public boolean getUseSessionParams()
        Returns TRUE if some Oracle specific session parameters need to be set before inference is run.

      • getVMName

        public java.lang.String getVMName()

      • hasValidModelId

        public boolean hasValidModelId()
        Returns if model has a valid id. Model id number must not be 0.
        Returns:

      • hasVirtualModel

        public boolean hasVirtualModel()
        This method returns TRUE if the name of virtual model is not null.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether this model based is closed or not. A closed model base may not be able to perform certain operations because its connections may be closed and/or its state discarded.

        Note that calling closeWithoutCommit() will not necessarily close this model base. A model base closes only when all references to the model base have called closeWithoutCommit().

        Returns:
        true if this model base is closed, false otherwise

      • isDB_19_3_OrAfter

        public boolean isDB_19_3_OrAfter()
        Returns if database is version 19.3.x and beyond. From 19.3 database the application table does not exist anymore for private neworks, although an internal view is created to simulate it existence. So the adapter can keep referring to an application table, but should not create or drop table/indexes anymore.
        Returns:

      • isMDSYSnetwork

        public boolean isMDSYSnetwork()
        Returns if semantic network is owned by MDSYS (for old databases 12c and 18c).
        Returns:
        true if network owner is null or equal to "MDSYS"

      • isNetworkOwnerDefined

        public boolean isNetworkOwnerDefined()
        Returns if local network parameters are defined.
        Returns:
        true if at least network owner is defined, otherwise returns false

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()

      • performInference

        public void performInference()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error during native inferencing.

      • performInference

        public void performInference(java.lang.String components)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out. Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        Parameters:
        components - specifies the INF_COMPONENTS_IN parameter in the SEM_APIS.CREATE_ENTAILMENT PL/SQL interface. It is only applicable to Oracle 11g and it can be NULL. When not null, it provides the ability for selective inferencing. See the following document for details: Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is server side error.

      • performInference

        public void performInference(java.lang.String components,
                             java.lang.String deltaModel)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out. Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        Parameters:
        components - specifies the INF_COMPONENTS_IN parameter in the SEM_APIS.CREATE_ENTAILMENT PL/SQL interface. It is only applicable to Oracle 11g and it can be NULL. When not null, it provides the ability for selective inferencing. See the following document for details: Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1)
        deltaModel - the name of the model that stores additional triples for incremental inference. Please refer to the delta_in parameter of SEM_APIS.create_entailment API in the Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide. It can be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is server side error.

      • retrieveModelId

        public void retrieveModelId()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inquires and updates the internal ID assigned for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph object.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error happening to the underlying SQL execution.

      • rollbackTransaction

        public void rollbackTransaction()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Rollback changes done to the graph.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setDOP

        public void setDOP(int i)
        This method sets of degree of parallelism for underlying SQL operations.

      • setImplicitBulkLoadFlags

        public void setImplicitBulkLoadFlags(java.lang.String flags)
        This method sets the flags (options) to be used when bulk loader is chosen implicitly to load a graph. The flags set here will not affect the completeBulk API.

      • setImplicitBulkLoadListener

        public void setImplicitBulkLoadListener(StatusListener sl)
        This method sets the StatusListener object to be used when bulk loader is chosen implicitly to load a graph. The StatusListener object set here will not affect the completeBulk API.

      • setInferenceOption

        public void setInferenceOption(java.lang.String inferenceOption)
        Set the inference option used by performInference (create_entailment).
        Parameters:
        inferenceOption - the inference option to be used by future performInference calls. One can enable parallel, incremental inference, and/or set using RAW datatype through this API.

      • setQueryFetchSize

        public void setQueryFetchSize(int size)
        Gives the underlying JDBC driver a hint as to the number of rows that should be fetched from the database when more rows are needed for query answering.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of rows that should be fetched from a result set

      • setQueryInferenceGraphOnly

        public void setQueryInferenceGraphOnly(boolean b)
        This function will add INF_ONLY=T option to the underlying query when b is set to true.
        Parameters:
        b - allows query to run against just the inferred graph when set to true. It is only applicable when there is a rulebase attached.

      • setUseSessionParams

        public void setUseSessionParams(boolean b)
        There are two Oracle session parameters that may help inference performance.
        Parameters:
        b - specifies whether some Oracle specific sessions parameters are used or not
